one_reviews_text:
Fits the niche genre I love most - existential problems concerning the creation of AI.  It was rather short, and while that was a bit disappointing, sometimes you don't need much to get the point across.

Only real bit of criticism is that being attached to a character with a body that looks nothing like my own broke the immersion for me - I'm not really the victim because of this, so I think it was a little less horrific than it could've been, and I have no info on who this person is for the most part so there isn't an emotional attachment to them either.  I know this was made in 2016 so there's probably not going to be an update, but if there were, I'd honestly probably recommend removing the viewer's body.

It's free, short, horrific, made me think, and in the end glad I gave it a go.
Great quality but is like a watch a video in VR

review_title: its a story thats not even worth while
one_reviews_text: i got it thinking it was a puzzle/escape room kinda thing. nope. just a robot telling me no one loves him, then he kills me. not even a good story. not worth you time.

It’s actually a film less than 5-min long... all you can do is look around and listen to Abe talk.  An interesting character, looks very cool.  But there’s nothing else to this... it’s cool, sure — but when you have seen it once you’re done.
booooooooring
cant even play it always crashes. can anyone help me solve this problem

To all who say "whats the point of this game?". Ehm it says "film" in the genre section... i really like how the feeling changes from scared to confused, then i was sad and at the end a bit disgusted. I like the bot, im sorry for him he just wants to help. Good job (but the end scene is pretty bad looking i think)
Cool game but not really scary, just weird but not feeling like im in a danger

review_title: Great for those new to VR.
one_reviews_text: I recommend checking this out. Yes, it's short. However if you're new to VR, I find this to be a great "experience" to start with. It's a classic and you can't beat the price.
this is the most pointless game ever
what is the point? it youst looks like a failed concept project. bot the graphic is pretty good

review_title: Not sure what to make of it
one_reviews_text: Too short. Glad it was free. Interesting though. Left me with questions.
Short, cliche, and anti-climactic. The monologue dragged on and made me wonder when the talking would stop.
Good interactive aspect as the bodt actually follows your head movement.

Amazing Game. The Animation And Graphics Are Realistic (though the feet look quite strange). And The Story, Although Quite Short Was Very Suspenseful And At Some Points Slightly Emotional (Some People Arent As Empathetic So It Might Not Be Emotional For Some). Very Good Game :D

You can just turn on audiorecord of this "movie" – it will be the same.
By the way, the time of this "movie" – 7 minutes
I click start to play the game, but it just exit the game! It doesn't give me any error message. I don't know why it's not working.
doesnt even scare you the slightest bit
Extremely boring
Definately in the horror zone, not my cup of tea.
TO SHORT
Dull writing. Looks quite ok.

Well. The ending was terrible. I got excited for a minute in the beginning, but the robot just keeps going on and on. Thought about quitting a few times but wanted to see what would develop. Like everyone else says, this is too short, but I enjoyed it, right until the end, when it just got silly.
Also, it's not showing up as installed in my library (yet it obviously is), so I'll have to hack-uninstall it myself... odd.

This is short but it was great to put on for my dear mothers first VR experience. Told her she had to figure out how to escape before it was too late and she tried everything, even negotiating with the character (we were creased :'). Easy to get sucked into the story for such a short experience! Loved it
cool thought but it is just okay

Seriously boring, I just wanted the robot (who was contracticting himself quite a lot) to just shut up.  It was also extremely short, must have taken less than a day to create, and it feels it too.  Even though this is free I don't feel it's worthy of a download.
Yes.  Disturbing.

The graphics are good, and that's it. 

Stories are supposed to have exposition, development, climax, conclusion.  This simply never leaves the exposition. You *spoiler* sit and listen to what would be a tear jerking monologue from a beautiful robot if it weren't for the fact that it's rather obvious what the conclusion is.  This just isn't a story, not a very complete one at any rate; it's a character introduction. I got more out of RoboRecall than I did this.
abe is a seated hands free experience that can be enjoyed even with a DK 2 it was released quite some time ago and bots have been done better since but worth 5 mins of your time
Good graphics, good voice overs but as many said a bit short but it's a free vr experience.
I really liked the beginning and everything that was said but the end was weird and it was way too short. It has so much more potential!

I wanted to like this as it seemed like the sort of thing that scifi loves to deal with. What was delivered was far too slow and plodding, the dialog was stiff and the whole experience just lacked any real impact.

Very good graphics, but very short clip. Not interactive and although they try to make this a horror short story I don't think they accomplish it very well.
Looking forward to see a longer story based on this character.
it's really good but short.. i can't wait to see what comes next!
Boring and zero immersion

review_title: Good tech demo, that's all it is
one_reviews_text:
Not sure why people are slating it, maybe it's me watching too much Criminal Minds where people being tied to chairs and beds and killed is commonplace but I enjoyed the feeling of helplessness of not knowing what was to come. Was quite unnerving. 

It is just a tech demo though, a show of what can be done and a pretty good one at that. It seems UE4 handles VR very well which is a postive as it's behind many games these days and will be for some time to come. With more content my 3 would have been a 4, though as a demo it's almost worth that anyway but compared to other games etc on here it's very limited to wouldn't be right to give it higher. Worth a go but once you seen it once, the suspense goes forever making it pointless to own. Nice to show off to friends and family though I guess.
This is just a fun little horror experience. Don't expect too much.
Don't expect too much.  I thought it would be more interactive.
Short monologue by a robot in a horror setting. Ending was quite immersion breaking, it should have ended before it touched you imo.
don't download
the film is good but i think it should be longer, then i will like it even more
This is way to Short
This is really boring, unistalled it.
boring
make it longer and get me out of that room!! Has potential but cmon now -_-
I mean its free. Its a story you have all heard before, go play the Talos Principle if you want more plot like this.
Nice visuals but a mediocre plot. The last bit felt somewhat uncomfortable but I wouldn't call that scary.

Things like this should not be made, I got out as soon as I realised what it was,
A sad reflection on the human race that they think this is entertainment and OK.
God Bless Allen

I'm not sure I understand the 1 star reviews.  This is a short, VR demo cinematic experience.  You have the perspective of the hostage of the robot.  The robot is talking about your soon to be demise.  This is where you, as the audience, can either accept or reject this reality (perception is reality).  Blue pill or red pill.  I enjoyed it.  But my main problem was that for whatever reason, I wasn't situated exactly where the hostage was.  So I lost a lot of the immersion because where I was wasn't exactly where the hostage was.  I think before the movie starts, they should give you an alignment of where you're supposed to be so that you don't lose immersion.  Not the best dialogue, but for a VR demo, it's up there in quality.  Graphics could also be higher quality.
Interesting short film for the platform. It is a fun experience, but be warned that it is sci-fi horror.
I watched until he got out the scapel and noped riiiiiight out of there! Gross. haha. Well done however as a showcase. Horror films could have quite the future in VR!!!
This was definitely fun to watch. It shows the potential of film making in VR.

This is fine, it isn't great.
It isn't perfect, but it is fun to watch and okay for a few minutes.

For the aspect issue: reset your app view forward, then once back in "video" move physically back in your chair, this had my "body" roughly in the correct place.

For immersion, try and keep your hands in the same place as those on your body.
Well worth a look.
Cant even launch it, get an unrealengine crash code that gives no deatils as to what the problem is
Really annoyed at people ripping these short clips. What do you want for free? Its a short video and just a glimpse of things that could be achieved. Open your minds!

review_title: wtf.. really pointless and NOT horror
one_reviews_text: Can you really call it a STORY? It is a pretentious monologue, boring, and some cheap "blood" at the end for some seconds. Waste of bandwidth and time. And they even mention "ORIGINAL character design" in the credits. That must be a joke. The robot is as generic and uninspiring as it could be. Also, TWO "executive producers"... I mean come on, this is not even amateur-level production.
Double Wack

Predictable.

PS, its just as annoying seeing the inevitable fanboy review assuming that his opinion is the only one that means anything. Free Poop is still poop.
pretty standard, sit still as some robot rants like a villian and then it ends how you'd expect a horror to end. Not scary, but yeah. it's just "meh"
Boring, poor graphics, VR has now better demo since..
Garbageware. Basically you sit there and listen to a robot complain that nobody loves him. NO GAMEPLAY YOU JUST SIT AND WATCH.

review_title: I was affraid of dying of boredom
one_reviews_text: Would you watch this on tv? No! So why make it in the first place. You can feel the arrogance of the creators in the dialog.
Cool experience, great story!
A neat VR experience!

review_title: Left yourself be immersed and it pays
one_reviews_text: An old app.  It's still decent. If you're patient with this, and let yourself get immersed, it's a good experience.  I quite like the dialogue.  There's a really creepy feel to the whole experience.   Would give 3.5 stars if I could.  3 seems a little unfair but 4 too much.
Its a good starting experience for VR...and it's free.

The reviewer below seems unimpressed but I think he wrote a review on the wrong short animated film because this short experience is absolutely amazing! It was so intense, it left me wanting more. I really do hope they make more content like this as I would happily pay. I even thought wouldn't it be amazing if they could make this into a full movie! Everyone I have shown this to so far has loved it as well. Definitely recommend everyone watching it for yourself, it's extremely high quality and well made. I've watched nearly all short animated films on Oculus store and so far this one is the best by far! 10/10.
When(no one is home): set up a nice reclined seat; lay back and try to relax;  VERY SCARY at the start but can get boring when the robot starts talking about his family
Too much boring dialogue, not enough substance. At least it's free. Should have settings for gory or less gory experience and hack the limbs off! Let's see some guts ripped out, now that's "fun"! ;)
Short but deserve to see al least once.

While there are other experiences on the store, some may charge up to $10 for a similar experience. If you're looking for a cool sci-fi short story, you have nothing to lose by trying this out. Excellent taste of the VR promise for story-telling.
Great short story for free

It was...interesting I guess.  Maybe if this was like, your first VR experience it may be a bit more exciting.  But for the rest of us who have experienced proper VR already its a big let down.  its about 5 minutes long, a lot of dialogue, its a semi creepy atmosphere, but really, even dreadhalls is scarier than this (mind you dreadhalls is a good game and scary but there are much better alternatives now albeit more pricey).  I have it a 2/5, 1 star for being "interesting" and the 2nd because at least it was free.  Maybe if it was longer, i dont know.
I'm a huge fan on the short film this is based on and this was a great little accompanying experience.
the voice acting is good, and compelling short story
This works really well. Great voice actor too. I was really impressed. Brilliant!

immersive.....chilling....and atmospheric...beautiful music also.  I think VR shines in things like this where we are given essencially....a "scene" rather than a full game. VR has to walk before it can run.

VR, is like eating your favourite cake, the first bite is always the best but once you get used to it, or have to much, it gets bland and/or nauseating.

So if this was your first experience in vr it probably would have been graded much higher.
For free I thought this was good
This was a very interesting experience!  Please make more!
Very short, cool the first, you don't know what to expect, but after that its dull.
Trying to be smart and intellegently designed experience but fails. 2/5 for being free.
Graphics are good. Story is bland. Too much dialogue, but it does entertain for a few minutes. Was pretty good for free experience.

I have to admit I installed this and put it off for the longest time out of fear not being able to stomache it. What I thought was a snuff application, is a rather interesting view into the philosophy of an A.I. that doesn't understand its own use of human emotion. Perhaps not the most original concept, but interesting all the same.

The gore that was present didn't warrant the worry I had. There are no jump scares, just a little blood.
In a dark dark sort of way

review_title: Odd experience, the end is hilarious
one_reviews_text: Saw the original tech demo back then for the Unreal Engine and the video itself was thrilling and a blast. The demo for the Rift instead is hilarious and the end made me laugh. Even the iconic butterfly moment is kinda lame. Sound's off too.

review_title: Not great, but shows what's possible
one_reviews_text: For a robot philosopher, Abe rambles on too long, somewhat like those dull Architect scenes in The Matrix movies.  Before long, you just want him to shut up and get on with the cuttin'.  That said, the sense of body presence is done very well, and you can definitely feel the helplessness; as a precursor to future potential horror games along the same lines of imprisonment and body horror, it shows hints of what might be possible.
Positional tracking is restricted and warped so as to not be 1:1, which is HORRIBLE. Sound also doesn't sound 3D.
Interesting story, but left me feeling kind of unhappy and depressed lol
Technologically  impressive and immersive Sci-Fi horror "short" that has way too much dialogue. Worth a one-time watch.
Pretty good, worth a watch
Watch once and uninstall
I enjoyed it, but didn't really feel connected or particularly immersed.
The environment and Abe himself are very creepy, but the scene just takes too long to play out.  At some point you'll just want Abe to be done with it.
A real sense of intimidation and danger. Your body presence is very good and when you get immersed like that the ending makes you feel really weird when it happens
confronting!
Too long for a tech demo.
this needs a little more horror movie vibe, but it is a good start to show others what VR is capable of.
Super cheesy and cringe-worthy dialogue
